pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Friday, January 29, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

11:30 a.m. The Prime Minister will address Canadians on the COVID-19 situation. A media availability will follow.

Rideau Cottage
1 Sussex Drive

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive to the Princess Anne Entrance no later than 11:00 a.m. and to make their way to the P1 Gate once on the grounds.
  • Media wishing to cover the event must be accredited with the Parliamentary Press Gallery.
  • Journalists can dial in to listen and ask questions to the Prime Minister.
  • Participant dial-in numbers:
    Local: 613-954-9003
    Toll-free: 1-866-206-0153
    Pass code: 6822783#

3:40 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually meet with Handi-Capable and L’Élan des Jeunes, two local housing organizations supporting the implementation of affordable housing projects in Sherbrooke and Châteauguay under the Rapid Housing Initiative. He will be joined by Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Economic Development and Official Languages (Economic Development Agency of Canada for the Regions of Quebec) Élisabeth Brière and Member of Parliament for Châteauguay—Lacolle Brenda Shanahan.

4:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually visit Hon’s Asian Comfort Food, a local business in Vancouver, British Columbia, with Minister of National Defence Harjit Sajjan.

Closed to media.
